content.text:
[@joey](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) 

I found a handful of websites advertising that 23% NaCl solution lowers the freeze point to around -21 F, which makes sense to me. I'll be curious if your experiment shows the same thing. I looked around for a salt brine phase diagram and found this:

![diagram showing the freeze point of salt brine which has the lowest freeze point at 23.3% NaCl](&0rlekQzEG+RtaYBHHlDYJ0MxlFIi1n7IGWYoJ8xPkeg=.sha256)

mentions.name: diagram showing the freeze point of salt brine which has the lowest freeze point at 23.3% NaCl
